trans-unit.source: Represents a databindable, customized view of a <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> for sorting, filtering, searching, editing, and navigation.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> does not store data, but instead represents a connected view of its corresponding <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
Changes to the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>’s data will affect the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
Changes to the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>’s data will affect all <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>s associated with it.
A major function of the <xref:System.Data.DataView> is to allow for data binding on both Windows Forms and Web Forms.
Additionally, a <xref:System.Data.DataView> can be customized to present a subset of data from the <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
This capability lets you have two controls bound to the same <xref:System.Data.DataTable>, but that show different versions of the data.

For example, one control might be bound to a <xref:System.Data.DataView> that shows all the rows in the table, and a second might be configured to display only the rows that have been deleted from the <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
The <xref:System.Data.DataTable> also has a <xref:System.Data.DataTable.DefaultView%2A> property.
This returns the default <xref:System.Data.DataView> for the table.

For example, if you want to create a custom view on the table, set the <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowFilter%2A> on the <xref:System.Data.DataView> returned by the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.DefaultView%2A>.
To create a filtered and sorted view of data, set the <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowFilter%2A> and <xref:System.Data.DataView.Sort%2A> properties.
Then, use the <xref:System.Data.DataView.Item%2A> property to return a single <xref:System.Data.DataRowView>.
You can also add and delete from the set of rows using the <xref:System.Data.DataView.AddNew%2A> and <xref:System.Data.DataView.Delete%2A> methods.
When you use those methods, the <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowStateFilter%2A> property can set to specify that only deleted rows or new rows be displayed by the <xref:System.Data.DataView>.

If you do not explicitly specify sort criteria for `DataView`, the `DataRowView` objects in `DataView` are sorted based on the index of DataView's corresponding `DataRow` in the `DataTable.Rows` `DataRowCollection`.

[!INCLUDE[linq_dataset](~/includes/linq-dataset-md.md)] allows developers to create complex, powerful queries over a <xref:System.Data.DataSet> by using [!INCLUDE[vbteclinq](~/includes/vbteclinq-md.md)].
A [!INCLUDE[linq_dataset](~/includes/linq-dataset-md.md)] query returns an enumeration of <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects, however, which is not easily used in a binding scenario.
<xref:System.Data.DataView> can be created from a [!INCLUDE[linq_dataset](~/includes/linq-dataset-md.md)] query and takes on the filtering and sorting characteristics of that query.

[!INCLUDE[linq_dataset](~/includes/linq-dataset-md.md)] extends the functionality of the <xref:System.Data.DataView> by providing [!INCLUDE[vbteclinq](~/includes/vbteclinq-md.md)] expression-based filtering and sorting, which allows for much more complex and powerful filtering and sorting operations than string-based filtering and sorting.
See [Data Binding and LINQ to DataSet](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/data-binding-and-linq-to-dataset.md) for more information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Data.DataView.RowFilter"></xref>, <xref href="System.Data.DataView.Sort"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Data.DataViewRowState"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataView.RowFilter"></xref> to apply to the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataView.Sort"></xref> to apply to the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataViewRowState"></xref> to apply to the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
Adds a new row to the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView"></xref> object.
Sets or gets a value that indicates whether deletes are allowed.
`true`, if deletes are allowed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether edits are allowed.
`true`, if edits are allowed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the new rows can be added by using the <xref href="System.Data.DataView.AddNew"></xref> method.
`true`, if new rows can be added; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use the default sort.
The default sort is (ascending) by all primary keys as specified by <xref href="System.Data.DataTable.PrimaryKey"></xref>.
`true`, if the default sort is used; otherwise, `false`.
Starts the initialization of a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> that is used on a form or used by another component.
The initialization occurs at runtime.
The Visual Studio .NET design environment uses this method to start the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component.
The <xref:System.Data.DataView.EndInit%2A> method ends the initialization.
Using the `BeginInit` and `EndInit` methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.
Closes the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
The method lets you manually close the <xref:System.Data.DataView> in derived classes.
Use the corresponding <xref:System.Data.DataView.Open%2A> method to open the <xref:System.Data.DataView>.
This property is designed for internal use only.
Occurs after a <xref href="System.Data.DataColumnCollection"></xref> has been changed successfully.
The source of the event.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ListChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Copies items into an array.
Only for Web Forms Interfaces.
array to copy into.
index to start at.

Gets the number of records in the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> after <xref href="System.Data.DataView.RowFilter"></xref> and <xref href="System.Data.DataView.RowStateFilter"></xref> have been applied.
The number of records in the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewManager"></xref> associated with this view.
The `DataViewManager` that created this view.

If this is the default <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> for a <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>, the `DataViewManager` property returns the default `DataViewManager` for the `DataSet`.
Otherwise, if the `DataView` was created without a `DataViewManager`, this property is `null`.
Deletes a row at the specified index.
After deleting a <xref:System.Data.DataRow>, its state changes to `DataViewRowState.Deleted`.
You can roll back the deletion by calling <xref:System.Data.DataTable.RejectChanges%2A> on the <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
The index of the row to delete.
Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> object.
Property change notifications between the <xref:System.Data.DataView> and the underlying <xref:System.Data.DataTable> stop after this method is called.
<xref:System.Data.DataView.Dispose%2A> should be called for all <xref:System.Data.DataView> objects.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Ends the initialization of a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> that is used on a form or used by another component.
The initialization occurs at runtime.
The Visual Studio .NET design environment uses this method to end the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component.
The <xref:System.Data.DataView.BeginInit%2A> method starts the initialization.
Using the `BeginInit` and `EndInit` methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> instances are considered equal.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> to be compared.
`true` if the two <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> instances are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Finds a row in the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> by the specified sort key values.
An array of values, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The index of the position of the first row in the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> that matches the sort key values specified; otherwise -1 if there are no matching sort key values.
Finds a row in the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> by the specified sort key value.
The object to search for.
The index of the row in the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> that contains the sort key value specified; otherwise -1 if the sort key value does not exist.
Returns an array of <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView"></xref> objects whose columns match the specified sort key value.
The column value, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>, to search for.
An array of `DataRowView` objects whose columns match the specified sort key value; or, if no rows contain the specified sort key values, an empty `DataRowView` array.
Returns an array of <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView"></xref> objects whose columns match the specified sort key value.
An array of column values, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>, to search for.
An array of `DataRowView` objects whose columns match the specified sort key value; or, if no rows contain the specified sort key values, an empty `DataRowView` array.
Gets an enumerator for this <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for navigating through the list.
Occurs after a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> has been changed successfully.
The source of the event.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ListChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when initialization of the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> is completed.
Gets a value that indicates whether the component is initialized.
`true` to indicate the component has completed initialization; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the data source is currently open and projecting views of data on the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Data.DataView> is a "view" on a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> because it provides custom sorting and filtering of the data.
The <xref:System.Data.DataView.IsOpen%2A> property can be queried to determine whether a <xref:System.Data.DataView> has been opened by using the <xref:System.Data.DataView.Open%2A> method.
This property is designed for internal use only.
`true`, if the source is open; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a row of data from a specified table.
The index of a record in the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataRowView"></xref> of the row that you want.
Occurs when the list managed by the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref> changes.
Raises the <xref href="System.Data.DataView.ListChanged"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ListChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Opens a <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
The method lets you manually open the <xref:System.Data.DataView> in derived classes.
Use the corresponding <xref:System.Data.DataView.Close%2A> method to close the <xref:System.Data.DataView>.
This property is designed for internal use only.
Reserved for internal use only.
Gets or sets the expression used to filter which rows are viewed in the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
To form a <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowFilter%2A> value, specify the name of a column followed by an operator and a value to filter on.
The value must be in quotation marks.
For example:
"LastName = 'Smith'"
See the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.Expression%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> class for more information.
To return only those columns with null values, use the following expression:
"Isnull(Col1,'Null Column') = 'Null Column'"
A string that specifies how rows are to be filtered.
Gets or sets the row state filter used in the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
Only rows that have been deleted by using the <xref:System.Data.DataView.Delete%2A> method will have their <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowStateFilter%2A> value set to `Deleted`.
Those rows added using the <xref:System.Data.DataView.AddNew%2A> method will similarly have the property set to `Added`.
Using the <xref:System.Data.DataRowCollection.Remove%2A> method of the <xref:System.Data.DataRowCollection> class does not mean that a row will be marked as `Deleted`.
Use the <xref:System.Data.DataView.Delete%2A> method instead to make sure that such rows can be viewed in the <xref:System.Data.DataView>.
New rows will also be visible when the <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowStateFilter%2A> is set to `ModifiedCurrent` or `CurrentRows`.
Deleted rows will also be visible when the <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowStateFilter%2A> is set to `ModifiedOriginal` and `OriginalRows`.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewRowState"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the sort column or columns, and sort order for the <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.

If you do not explicitly specify sort criteria for `DataView`, the `DataRowView` objects in `DataView` are sorted based on the index of its corresponding `DataRow` in the `DataTable.Rows` `DataRowCollection`.
For more information, see [DataViews](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataset-datatable-dataview/dataviews.md).
A string that contains the column name followed by "ASC" (ascending) or "DESC" (descending).
Columns are sorted ascending by default.
Multiple columns can be separated by commas.
Gets or sets the source <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Data.DataTable> also has a <xref:System.Data.DataTable.DefaultView%2A> property which returns the default <xref:System.Data.DataView> for the table.

For example, if you want to create a custom view on the table, set the <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowFilter%2A> on the <xref:System.Data.DataView> returned by the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.DefaultView%2A>.
You can only set the <xref:System.Data.DataView.Table%2A> property if the current value is null.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that provides the data for this view.
Creates and returns a new <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> based on rows in an existing <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
Because this method does not let you specify the name for the output <xref:System.Data.DataTable>, its name is the same as the name of the source <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
If `true`, the returned <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> contains rows that have distinct values for all its columns.
The default value is `false`.
A string array that contains a list of the column names to be included in the returned <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> contains the specified columns in the order they appear within this array.
A new <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> instance that contains the requested rows and columns.
Creates and returns a new <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> based on rows in an existing <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
Because this method does not let you specify a subset of available columns, the output table contains the same columns as the input table.
The name of the returned <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> instance that contains the requested rows and columns.
Creates and returns a new <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> based on rows in an existing <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.

Use this overloaded version of the <xref:System.Data.DataView.ToTable%2A> method if you have to retrieve distinct values in a subset of available columns, specifying a new name for the returned <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
If you do not need distinct rows or a subset of columns, see <xref:System.Data.DataView.ToTable%2A>.
The name of the returned <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
If `true`, the returned <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> contains rows that have distinct values for all its columns.
The default value is `false`.
A string array that contains a list of the column names to be included in the returned <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
The `DataTable` contains the specified columns in the order they appear within this array.
A new <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> instance that contains the requested rows and columns.
Creates and returns a new <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> based on rows in an existing <xref href="System.Data.DataView"></xref>.
Because this method does not let you specify the name for the output <xref:System.Data.DataTable>, its name is the same as the name of the source `DataTable`.
Because this method does not let you specify a subset of available columns, the output table contains the same columns as the input table.
A new <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> instance that contains the requested rows and columns.
Reserved for internal use only.
Reserved for internal use only.
Reserved for internal use only.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.

This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
The use of this member is not supported and will cause a <xref:System.ArgumentException>.
Instead, use the Clear method on the <xref:System.Data.DataRowCollection> object returned by <xref:System.Data.DataTable.Rows%2A>.
